channel.title: Good News Network
channel.description: A Daily Dose of Positive News to Enthuse

item.title: “Chicken Lady” Found Courage To Ask For Leftovers, Still Feeding Homeless
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
For Amy Murphy, the hardest part of feeding the homeless was working up the nerve to ask a restaurant for leftovers. After that, finding the courage to wear a chicken hat in public every day was a piece of cake. The people in Greensboro, North Carolina know Murphy as the

The post “Chicken Lady” Found Courage To Ask For Leftovers, Still Feeding Homeless appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: UPS Delivers Big Cut in Greenhouse Gases with 46M Gallon Renewable Diesel Deal
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
United Parcel Service (UPS) has committed to buying 46 million gallons of renewable diesel made from waste oils and animal fats, delivering on its promise to cut petroleum-based fuel use by 12% in the next two years. Renewable diesel produces up to 90% less greenhouse gas emissions than conventional diesel.

The post UPS Delivers Big Cut in Greenhouse Gases with 46M Gallon Renewable Diesel Deal appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Trophy-Hunted Lion’s Tragedy Leads to Animal Rights Triumphs
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
On July 2, Cecil, a 13-year-old male Southwest African lion, was killed in a hunting expedition in Zimbabwe. A main attraction at the Hwange National Park, Cecil was shot with a cross bow by an American dentist who was led by a licensed local game-hunter. Whether he believed he had the proper

The post Trophy-Hunted Lion’s Tragedy Leads to Animal Rights Triumphs appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Skyrocketing Donations Save the First Spacesuit Worn on the Moon
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
When the Smithsonian Institution took the small step of launching a Kickstarter campaign to save the spacesuit Neil Armstrong wore on the first moonwalk, there was a giant leap of donations. The museum reached its half-million dollar goal to “Reboot the Suit” in just five days — so it raised

The post Skyrocketing Donations Save the First Spacesuit Worn on the Moon appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Adorable: Bride Has 89-year-old Grandmother as One of Her Bridesmaids
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
At Christine Quinn’s Pennsylvania wedding in May, one of her bridesmaids was her 89-year-old grandmother. Nana Betty was hesitant at first, worried that she wasn’t as “young and pretty” as the other bridesmaids—but the sassy senior happily donned the same dress as the other ladies in the bridal party–and even joined

The post Adorable: Bride Has 89-year-old Grandmother as One of Her Bridesmaids appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Homeless Shelter’s 80-Bed Rooftop Garden Cultivates Fresh Food and Job Skills
item.dc:creator: Linda Hernandez
item.description:
Shelter residents are harvesting organic produce to nourish themselves while growing their skills for an eventual return to the workforce. The Metro Atlanta Task Force for the Homeless started its rooftop garden in 2009 to teach homeless people about urban farming and organic food production. Now the gardeners harvest from 80

The post Homeless Shelter’s 80-Bed Rooftop Garden Cultivates Fresh Food and Job Skills appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Boxing Champ Helps 4-yo “Get Back Up” After iPad is Snatched From His Little Hands
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
After a four-year-old lost his iPad to a thief, he soon discovered that he had a former boxing champion in his corner. When Howard Davis, Jr. and his wife saw the video of a boy in Tamarac, Florida, getting the gadget snatched from his hands, they decided to stop by to provide relief, and a little

The post Boxing Champ Helps 4-yo “Get Back Up” After iPad is Snatched From His Little Hands appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 5
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
40 years ago on this day, guitarist Joan Jett and drummer Sandy West formed the first all-girl hard rock band, after being introduced by a producer. On their self-titled debut album, The Runaways scored a hit with ‘Cherry Bomb,’ a single that reached No.1 in Japan. (1975) MORE Good News

The post Good News in History, August 5 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Child Refugee From War Torn Somalia Goes Back to Run For President
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
After fleeing her homeland almost 25 years ago, Fadumo Dayib has decided she wants to be president of Somalia. “I’m generally an optimist,”  Ms. Dayib told Good News Network. She certainly needs to be, since she’s the first female candidate in the nation and going up against some fiery opponents in a male-dominated country.

The post Child Refugee From War Torn Somalia Goes Back to Run For President appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Balloon Released at Gravesite Flies 25 Miles, Straight Home to Family
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
On her first Father’s Day without her dad, 13-year-old Saige Seibold and her mother Sandy decided to “send a message to Heaven.” They were stunned by the sudden reply. John Seibold had passed away just a month earlier, and his wife and daughter (pictured left) visited his grave to release

The post Balloon Released at Gravesite Flies 25 Miles, Straight Home to Family appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Policeman Risks Spraying to Save Skunk From Yogurt Can Situation
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
Caught on cop cam: officer risks the wrath of a scared skunk to help free him from a yogurt container. While Rochester, Michigan Officer Merlin Taylor was on patrol, his squad car pulled up near a skunk running in circles with his head stuck in a yogurt container. Poor little guy—he

The post Policeman Risks Spraying to Save Skunk From Yogurt Can Situation appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: How to Turn Off GNN Notifications or Turn Back On
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
A thousand apologies go out to Good News Network fans who experienced our deluge of notifications that accidentally went out on August 4. We had a problem when deactivating a WordPress plugin and so had to secretly republish all 366 On This Day in History columns. Unfortunately, my tech team and

The post How to Turn Off GNN Notifications or Turn Back On appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: 5-yr Study Reveals Why Ovarian Cancer Recurs and How to Stop It
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Scientists have finally discovered why ovarian cancer frequently comes back after patients receive chemotherapy—and they’ve also found a way to potentially eliminate the recurrence rate for half of patients who have the disease. A five-year study at the University of California at Los Angeles found that coupling chemotherapy with an experimental drug called

The post 5-yr Study Reveals Why Ovarian Cancer Recurs and How to Stop It appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Fanny Packs Are In! “Hip Appeal” Offers Discrete Storage With Style
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
According to Cosmopolitan’s August issue, Fanny Packs are, once again, the “in” thing. This is great news for GNN’s founder, Geri, who loved hers back in the day. But recently, long since having ditched her clunky fanny pack, she found herself headed to an all-day concert festival and needed to literally go buy pants just for

The post Fanny Packs Are In! “Hip Appeal” Offers Discrete Storage With Style appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Youngest Black Actor Makes History Twice in ‘Les Miz’ Broadway Role
item.dc:creator: Linda Hernandez
item.description:
Who can honestly say they landed their dream job right out of college? Kyle Jean-Baptiste can–and he’s making history twice by doing it. Right after graduation, the 21-year-old tenor was cast in the Broadway revival of “Les Misérables” playing the roles of Constable and Courfeyrac. He was also cast as an understudy

The post Youngest Black Actor Makes History Twice in ‘Les Miz’ Broadway Role appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Field of Greens: Baseball Stadiums Grow Veggies on Roof to Feed Fans
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
Take me out to the garrr-den! Take me out to the greens! Forget peanuts and Cracker Jacks. A handful of Major League Baseball teams have started ‘farming the back 40’—and, in some cases, their sun-drenched stadium rooftops—to add healthier food choices to their concession menus while improving their operations’ sustainability.

The post Field of Greens: Baseball Stadiums Grow Veggies on Roof to Feed Fans appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 4
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
On this day 115 years ago, Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother was born. The wife of King George VI and mother of Queen Elizabeth II, she provided moral support to the British public during World War II and to her husband, as portrayed in the Academy Award Winning film The King’s Speech. MORE

The post Good News in History, August 4 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Obama Dances in Kenya Joining a Folk Dance Craze (WATCH)
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Not all formal state dinners have to be stuffy affairs with stiff toasts and stiffer collars. This one gave politicians and dignitaries a chance to move their hips to a traditional folk dance which is currently rocking African nightclubs. U.S. President Barack Obama joined Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta to perform the

The post Obama Dances in Kenya Joining a Folk Dance Craze (WATCH) appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Author Judy Blume Saves His Marriage After Man Tosses Wife’s Prized Book
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Leonard Lasek set out some old books to give away, but didn’t realize one of those books — Judy Blume’s “Are You There God? It’s Me, Margaret” — was a prized possession of his wife, Katie, until it was gone.  Desperate to find it, he posted flyers around his Brooklyn,

The post Author Judy Blume Saves His Marriage After Man Tosses Wife’s Prized Book appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Clear Your Schedule: Baby Kitten Cuddling is a Real Volunteer Job
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
If kittens, cuddles, and saving lives are up your alley, we’ve got just the volunteer job for you. In hopes of making shelter kitties more adoptable—and providing them with the love and care they need early in life—Best Friends Animal Society in Salt Lake City, Utah and Los Angeles, California

The post Clear Your Schedule: Baby Kitten Cuddling is a Real Volunteer Job appeared first on Good News Network.
